gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Met Office Hadley Centre, Fitzroy Road, Exeter, Devon, UK, EX1 3PB
Met Office Hadley Centre, Fitzroy Road, Exeter, Devon, UK, EX1 3PB

simulationRun.description: Consistent with PMIP specifications (https://pmip3.lsce.ipsl.fr/wiki/doku.php/pmip3:design:6K:final), simulation is run with midHolocene conditions, including atmospheric conditions of well-mixed gases and orbital variations. [Nominal start date is set to 1859-12-01 to match piControl run]. Only the final 35 years (i.e the reference dates of 1941 - 1975) of this simulation have been submitted to the CMIP5 archive.

reference.name: midHolocene
reference.description: Reference to an Experiment called midHolocene with experimentNumber 3.4

input.description: Fixed at preindustrial conditions. Dataset is derived from the historical annual time series prepared for CMIP5. This input field is interpolated by the model every 5 simulated days from the prescribed monthly mean field.

input.description: Fixed at pre-industrial conditions. Stratospheric ozone is prescribed as monthly zonal/height ancillary files taken from the CMIP5 recommended AC&C/SPARC ozone database. The values provided to the HadGEM2-CC include the effects of polar solar variability, as compared to the HadGEM2-ES runs which do not. These data were horizontally interpolated onto the model N96 horizontal grid. Vertical interpolation was achieved by mapping the SPARC ozone data from pressure surfaces onto pressure surface equivalent levels corresponding to the models height-based grid. Near-surface missing data was replaced by overlying nearest neighbour non-missing data.

reference.name: hadgem2-cc_ozone
reference.description: Reference to a dataObject called hadgem2-cc_ozone

reference.description: Reference to a modelComponent called Atmosphere

reference.name: well_mixed_gas_Ozone
reference.description: Reference to a componentProperty called well_mixed_gas_Ozone in a modelComponent called Atmosphere

input.description: Fixed at pre-industrial conditions. Stratospheric aerosol concentrations due to volcanic eruptions are varied across four equal area latitudinal zones on a monthly timescale. The aerosol is distributed vertically above the tropopause such that the mass mixing ratio is constant across the levels. In this version of the model, volcanic aerosol is not related to, and does not interact with, other simulated aerosol behaviour. The dataset used for the historic period was monthly stratospheric optical depths, at 550nm, from 1850 to 2000 (Sato et al., 1993).Background aerosols concentrations are covered in the sulphur_dioxide_emissions input. HadGEM2-CC does not treat any gases from volcanic sources as a climate forcing.

reference.name: volcanic aerosol
reference.description: Reference to a componentProperty called volcanic aerosol in a modelComponent called Atmosphere

input.description: Fixed at preindustrial conditions. Dataset is derived from Andres and Kasgnoc (1998). The total emissions are presented as annual values with the emissions constant at 0.62 Tg[S]/yr). The distribution of emissions varies from year to year, both horizontally and vertically.

reference.description: Reference to a componentProperty called volcanic SO2 emissions in a modelComponent called Atmosphere

input.description: Fixed at preindustrial conditions. Dataset is derived from Spiro et al. (1992) and has a constant annual rate of 0.86 Tg[S]/yr. The emissions are presented monthly and vary horizontally and by month to account for seasonal effects.

input.description: Fixed at preindustrial conditions. Annual mean variations in total solar irradiance (TSI) passed to the model are partitioned across six shortwave spectral bands (0.2-10um) to estimate the associated spectral changes with TSI variations (Lean et al., 1995). With the changes across the spectral bands the Rayleigh scattering and ozone absorption properties are also varied in the model. The TSI data used for the historic period were recommended by CMIP5 (Lean et al., SOLARIS 2009) and are created from reconstructions of solar cycle and background variations in TSI. The annual mean TSI was processed to force the mean of the 1700-2004 period to be the same as the model control solar constant value (1365 Wm-2).

input.description: Secondary organic aerosols from biogenic emissions are represented by monthly distributions of three-dimensional mass-mixing ratios obtained from the chemistry transport model (Derwent et al., 2003). These distributions are presented as monthly 3D profiles that are constant for all simulated years.

input.description: The historical land use data is based on the HYDE database v3.1 (Klein Goldewijk et al., 2010a; Klein Goldewijk et al., 2010b) as processed for CMIP5 by Hurtt et al (2010), and made available at 0.5 x 0.5 degree resolution. These fractions are mapped on to the N96 grid using area average re-gridding.

authorsList.list: C. Marzin, R. Kahana, C Jones

conformance.description: The concentrations of well mixed gases was set to the PMIP defined values except for the CO2 concentration which was fixed at 286 ppm rather than 280 ppm. The concentrations used were: [ CO2 = 286 ppm ], [ CH4 = 650 ppb ], [ N2O = 270 ppb ], [ CFC = 0 ], [ O3 = same as in HadGEM2-CC preindustrial run ]

reference.name: bc.070
reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called bc.070 in a experiment called 3.4 midHolocene

conformance.description: Orbital parameters were set to PMIP required values: [ ecc = 0.018682 ], [ obl = 24.105° ], [ peri-180° = 0.87° ]. The date of the vernal equinox was set to March 21 at noon.

reference.name: bc.069
reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called bc.069 in a experiment called 3.4 midHolocene

conformance.description: Solar constant was same as for the HadGEM2-CC preindustrial simulation

reference.name: bc.071
reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called bc.071 in a experiment called 3.4 midHolocene

reference.name: ic.001
reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called ic.001 in a experiment called 3.4 midHolocene

conformance.description: Although the simulation was run for 100 years, due to problems in the early part of the simulation only the final 35 years have been submitted.

reference.name: stc.028
reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called stc.028 in a experiment called 3.4 midHolocene

reference.name: IBM Power 6
reference.description: Reference to a platform called IBM Power 6

reference.name: HadGEM2-CC
reference.description: Reference to a modelComponent called HadGEM2-CC

standard.name: QN_DRS
standard.description: The QN_DRS value allows mapping from data files to metadata being exported from the metadata questionnaire, and contains the institution name, the model name on which the simulation was run, the experiment name to which the simulation conforms, the simulation level base rip value, and finally the given start year for the simulation. The format of the string will thus be: institute_model_experiment_rip_startyear. Also note, that in particular cases, i.e. decadal and noVolc exps, the start date and expdate may differ - this will occur in those cases where the simulation start date is 1st january but still refers to an experiment for the year before. - (see cmip5 experiment design document)
